page.title: 14Law and Order
page.content: There is no resident policeman in the area. Playford and Bealings are looked after from Kesgrove, Rushmere from Ipswich. Crime is not a major problem. Minor vandalism exists and is bothesome but despite the many large and isolated houses burglaries and break-ins are not common. The police say their relationship with the public in Suffolk as a whole is very good. The local magistrates' court is at Woodbridge, the Crown court at Ipswich. The preence of to U S Air Force bases some miles away has led to several US servicemen and families living here. providing quite a good (taxed) income for home owners, with no problem of re-occupation. Heavy and fast military aircraft overhad seem to cause little disturance to local people. Each village has its war memoial adjacent to the parish church.
